intro: Tupistra malaiana, commonly known as the Malayan tufted spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and branched stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
